main event: A large, bright yellow object was observed crossing the sky in Brooklyn, New York, on October 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being as large as a fist and moved at high speed from west to northeast., The sighting lasted for less than 10 seconds., The observer initially thought it was a shooting star, but later speculated it might have been a satellite., The report was forwarded to the Office of Information Services, United States Air Force for consideration., The sighting was evaluated as a meteor sighting in a Project Blue Book record.
sighted object: a large, bright yellow ball of light
witness description: the observer emerged from the subway and viewed the object crossing the avenue
